intro: Vernonia constricta, commonly known as the narrowleaf ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of blue to purple flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist to wet habitats such as swamps, marshes, and along stream banks. Its leaves are narrow and often have a distinctive whitish or silver-colored underside, which helps in identifying the species. Vernonia constricta is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in wetland gardens.
